com.github.uberroot.ncjbot.modapi

Class RunningModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.uberroot.ncjbot.modapi.AbstractModule
      • com.github.uberroot.ncjbot.modapi.RunningModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BeaconingWatchdog, LazyOverlayManager, TestCLI

    public abstract class RunningModule
extends AbstractModule
implements java.lang.Runnable

    An AbstractClass for modules that actively perform tasks and require their own threadpools.

    Author:
    Carter Waxman

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor executor
      The thread pool executor assigned to the module.

      • Fields inherited from class com.github.uberroot.ncjbot.modapi.AbstractModule

        name, node

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RunningModule(LocalNode node) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void pause()
      Called when the module needs to suspend it's operations.
      abstract void resume()
      Called when the module needs to be awakened from a previously paused state.
      abstract void run()
      Called when the module should start or perform it's primary function.
      abstract void stop()
      Called when the module needs to finish its current tasks so that it can be unloaded.

      • Methods inherited from class com.github.uberroot.ncjbot.modapi.AbstractModule

        link, unlink

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • executor

        protected final java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor executor

        The thread pool executor assigned to the module.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RunningModule

        public RunningModule(LocalNode node)

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public abstract void run()

        Called when the module should start or perform it's primary function. If the module performs a continuous operation, this method should be used to start the operation on a thread from the thread pool.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • pause

        public abstract void pause()

        Called when the module needs to suspend it's operations. This method should not return until the module has fully suspended.

      • resume

        public abstract void resume()

        Called when the module needs to be awakened from a previously paused state.

      • stop

        public abstract void stop()

        Called when the module needs to finish its current tasks so that it can be unloaded. This method should not return until the module has completely stopped.
